result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason Peter Bakken was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason Peter Bakken is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason Peter Bakken was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DNA surcharge.

DE appeared.  DE to pay $200/mo comm 8-01-16.  PPF waived.  DE signed PPA. jaf
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif
c: Def & Atty. eif

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Christopher Stephen Petros   DF:  Jason Peter Bakken appeared. Case called at 4:03 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a PTC.  Atty Petros states there is an agreement. Recites agreement. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 in 16CM160. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Possession of THC in 16CM160. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 16CM160. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to file appeal. DE to set up a payment plan. Payments to begin August 1, 2016. 

Crt orders:

- Fine in the amount of $500.00

- Court costs of $243.00 and DNA Surcharge of $200.00
Pre-trial conference on July 1, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Close to a resolution. Address confirmed. Bond continues.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 1, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
